Backend Configuration

In this project we will use Firebase as a backend complement. Firebase is a Google Backend-as-a-Service (BaaS) platform that helps you build, improve and grow your applications. Firebase offers a wide range of features, but for the purposes of this application we will focus on the following services:

  • Firebase Authentication (For our user authentication service)
  • Firebase Realtime Database (As database)
  • Cloud Messaging (For Push Notifications)

Table of contents

  1. Create a Firebase project
  2. Register your app with Firebase (iOS)
  3. Register your app with Firebase (Android)
  4. Firebase Authentication
  5. Firebase Realtime Database
  6. Cloud Messaging (Push Notifications)

Create a Firebase project

Before you can add Firebase to your app, you need to create a Firebase project to connect to your iOS or Android app. Follow these steps or consult the Firebase documentation to create a new project.

  1. In the Firebase console, click Add project, then select or enter your Project name
  2. Click Continue.
  3. Click Create project

Firebase automatically provisions resources for your Firebase project. When the process completes, you’ll be taken to the overview page for your Firebase project in the Firebase console.
